item.title: I spent all weekend being a punching bag for Trumpers. Here's why I have no regrets.
item.description:
Over the weekend, I managed to attract the attention of the extremely online right for a tweet I posted about Clarence and Ginni Thomas. Given that I write a lot about right-wing media and am now driving traffic to it through no fault of my own, I thought it’d be appropriate to devote part of today’s newsletter to explaining why I stand by what I tweeted…

URL: https://aaronrupar.substack.com/p/clarence-thomas-ginni-thomas-interview?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Higher Education & the Public Sphere as ??? Institutions, &

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“I also find it very interesting that both largest rebellions in Russian history were not only raised by Cossacks, but by Cossacks from the exactly same village (stanitsa) - Zimoveyskaya, now Pugachevskaya. This isn’t an accident. That’s the power of mythos and why memory matters”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1505922940738572292

source: Best of Twitter - Week of March 28, 2022

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“Rule of thumb: lower nobility hates higher nobility. They aren’t dumb and won’t tell it publicly, but privately, in between, that’s *the* main topic of their conversation when higher nobility isn’t around. Lower nobility wants to become higher nobility, eliminating the higher ups”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1505923132707639296

source: Best of Twitter - Week of March 28, 2022

item.title: Thomas Oertner
item.description:
Thomas Oertner on Twitter

“How come generations of researchers missed the importance of Ca2+ release for LTP? When you patch a neuron, ER gets damaged and all intracellular signaling is broken. All-optical experiments show the real synaptic physiology! https://t.co/RZTNSOHOXB”

URL: https://twitter.com/OertnerLab/status/1504825897643294724

source: Best of Twitter - Week of March 28, 2022

item.title: shakoist
item.description:
shakoist on Twitter

“Funny thing about going to a smaller company from big tech, is I’m suddenly missing all the process and review that used to drive me insane. People rly just be making insane decisions with no one to tell them to stop.”

URL: https://twitter.com/cauchyfriend/status/1504730485104136194

source: Best of Twitter - Week of March 28, 2022

item.title: Alexander Kruel
item.description:
Alexander Kruel on Twitter

“Whenever you hear breathless media reports about cities drowning due to climate change remember that 33% of the Netherlands lies below sea level. Land reclamation began when the Netherlands was less developed than Bangladesh is today.”

URL: https://twitter.com/XiXiDu/status/1504790772180258819

source: Best of Twitter - Week of March 28, 2022

item.title: Andrew Mayne
item.description:
Andrew Mayne on Twitter

“I used OpenAI’s newest code model to make simple versions of games like Wordle, VR mazes and Zelda ENTIRELY through natural language. I told it what I wanted and did ZERO editing/coding. Post with demos: https://t.co/cWwK9VEY8v https://t.co/WC8ImoUBst”

URL: https://twitter.com/AndrewMayne/status/1504612428432125970

source: Best of Twitter - Week of March 28, 2022

item.title: Daniel MacArthur
item.description:
Daniel MacArthur on Twitter

“@erlichya We know of at least two omicron + omicron reinfections amongst our circle, one just four weeks apart. Second bouts haven’t seemed any milder. I don’t think people have a good model of what “living with COVID” is actually going to feel like.”

URL: https://twitter.com/dgmacarthur/status/1505326084614631425

source: Best of Twitter - Week of March 28, 2022
